Also, the top level of the finding aid (above the dsc) changed to conform to current Rubenstein Library and NC EAD standards as laid out in the Inventory Style Guide and in the NCEAD Best Practice Guidelines. accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Researchers must register and agree to copyright and privacy laws before using this collection.
All or portions of this collection may be housed off-site in Duke University's Library Service Center. There may be a 48-hour delay in obtaining these materials.
Please contact Research Services staff before visiting the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library to use this collection.

userestrict.head: Use Restrictions
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], J. Walter Thompson Company. Frankfurt Office. Burkhard Schwarz Papers, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p: The J. Walter Thompson Co. Archives. Frankfurt Office. Burkhard Schwarz Papers was received by the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library as a transfer in 1996.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Encoded by Ruth E. Bryan; Kristen Kramer
This collection is unprocessed: materials may not have been ordered and described beyond their original condition.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: The J. Walter Thompson Company (JWT) was founded in New York, N.Y., in 1864, and is one of the world's largest advertising agencies. The company's Frankfurt Office was opened in 1952. Burkhard Schwarz was an advertising executive in the Frankfurt Office of the J. Walter Thompson Company in the 1970s and 1980s.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: Correspondence, personnel files, financial summaries, client files, and files of prospects and new business contacts that detail the business activities of the J. Walter Thompson Co.'s Frankfurt Office and Burkhard Schwarz's work there (17,000 items, 22.7 linear feet, ca. 1973-1989). Correspondence includes discussion of the company's reorganization in 1986 and attempts at collaboration with affiliated offices (e.g. Hill and Knowlton). Clients include Nestlé, Kodak, Burger King, Ford, Sunlicht, Elida, Kellogg, and DeBeers. Other material includes complete copies of lectures on business issues by JWT associates and others; JWT's 3 Year Plans (for the 1980s); and minutes and proceedings from European advertising symposia, both JWT specific (e.g. Managers Monthly Assessment, European Managers Meeting) and industry-wide (e.g. Davos, EPCOT). Most of the material is in German, but many files contain some English, especially correspondence with other JWT offices, symposia, and general JWT memoranda. Accessioned as part of the J. Walter Thompson Company, Frankfurt Office Records, 1959-1991 and undated (96-009). Acquired as part of the John W. Hartman Center for Sales, Advertising, and Marketing History.
Processing note: This collection has not yet been fully processed and organized. Thus, box contents do not always reflect logical subject groupings.
